column5: June 7 Evening - drive to meet buddies in MI - pulse quickens June 8 Early morning - Head North - pulse quickens more june 8 mid morning - Cross the border at the Soo, buy beer at the duty free, cross into Canada, buy fishing license, exchange currency, head north. Pulse quickens more June 8 mid-day - buy groceries. Start drinking beer. Pulse quickens more June 9 early morning - flyout to our home away from home. Pulse quickens...need to keep urinating from excitement... June 9 mid-day - load up the boats...pulse racing Shortly there after....tap, tap...pulse at near coronary episode... Fish On!!! Pulse lowers to levels never achieved the rest of the year... I'm not excited am I?
We are heading to Donald Lake also. Fly in on June 8 - 14.. Leave a few Walleye for us.

I was heading up I-35 in central Iowa today and just on the NE side of the Jewell exit I noticed a nice gathering of rock piles. Probably 4 or 5 good stacks sitting together. Couldn't help but think that person is about to head to Canada for their yearly trip.
Yeah, it's kind of amazing how almost anything will remind you of the north woods when you have it in your blood. I like the way you think! The countdown continues! Bill Krejca
June 16 for me and my kids. Go Hawks!
7 good friends living in Denver, CO and originally from Waterloo, IA are leaving for Donald Lake in the Woodland Caribou park May 26th. Can't wait! GO HAWKEYES!!
Hawkfan, We saw this on our way up to Canada on Friday!

Oh god. I can't tell you how many things have set me off the past month about heading to Canada. Everything from the weather, to smells, and of course reading Walleye Central every day. My wife must think I'm nuts. The wait continues....
I'm originally from Waterloo as well.
Hawkfan, you should consider increasing to two trips per year perhaps??

MorganMan, I know I have a brother that would make the second trip with me, but then all our wives would start pushing harder for that girls trip to Mexico. And I would want to be on that one too. I think I'd run out of vacation time at work...and maybe money in the bank!
